title: Provides an oral or written statement of an accused shall be inadmissible as evidence against such accused unless a recording is made of the interrogation
summary: Provides that an oral or written statement of an accused made as a result of a custodial interrogation shall be presumed inadmissible as evidence against such accused in any criminal proceeding charging a felony offense unless an electronic or video recording is made of such interrogation.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to the recording of statements in certain criminal investigations
